references.paper_title: Accuracy on the line: on the strong correlation between out-of-distribution and in-distribution generalization
references.reason: This paper empirically demonstrated strong linear correlations between in-distribution and out-of-distribution accuracy, a key finding that the current paper builds upon.

references.paper_title: Agreement-on-the-line: Predicting the performance of neural networks under distribution shift
references.reason: This paper introduced the concept of "agreement-on-the-line," which is leveraged in the current study to predict OOD performance.

references.paper_title: Benchmarking neural network robustness to common corruptions and perturbations
references.reason: This paper provides the benchmark datasets (CIFAR-10-C, CIFAR-100-C, ImageNet-C) used in the current study to evaluate the performance of test-time adaptation methods.

references.paper_title: Extending the wilds benchmark for unsupervised adaptation
references.reason: This paper introduces the WILDS benchmark datasets that are used in the current paper to test the generalizability of the findings.

references.paper_title: Tent: Fully test-time adaptation by entropy minimization
references.reason: This paper introduces TENT, one of the test-time adaptation methods used in this paper, which is shown to improve OOD performance and strengthen the linear correlations.
